headline: Will Deere’s (DE) US$20 Billion U.S. Manufacturing Pivot Reshape Its Long-Term Narrative?
summary: Deere & Company recently announced plans to expand its U.S. footprint by opening a new parts distribution center near Hebron, Indiana, and a cutting-edge excavator factory in Kernersville, North Carolina, both expected to begin operations next year and create roughly 300 jobs in total. By shifting future excavator production from Japan to North Carolina and tying these projects to a US$20.00 billion, decade-long American manufacturing commitment, Deere is signaling a deeper emphasis on...

headline: Trimble Extends Midwest Reach With West Side Tractor Partnership And Outlook
summary: Trimble (NasdaqGS:TRMB) named West Side Tractor Sales Co. a new Trimble Technology Outlet and authorized reseller. The partnership expands access to Trimble grade control and positioning systems for John Deere equipment users in northern Illinois, Indiana, and select Michigan counties. West Side Tractor Sales Co. will provide sales, installation, training, and support for Trimble construction technology solutions. Trimble, known for its positioning and construction technology, is adding...
